db:info.db:title: XdgPopup QML Type
db:info.db:edition: Qt Wayland Compositor | Commercial or GPLv3

db:abstract.db:para: XdgPopup represents the popup specific parts of and xdg surface.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This type is part of the XdgShell extension and provides a way to extend extend the functionality of an XdgSurface with features specific to desktop-style menus for an xdg surface.
It corresponds to the Wayland interface xdg_popup.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] anchorEdges : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the set of edges on the anchor rect that the child surface should be placed relative to. If no edges are specified in a direction, the anchor point should be centered between the edges.
The possible values are:

db:td.db:para: The top edge of the rectangle.
The left edge of the rectangle.
The right edge of the rectangle.
The bottom edge of the rectangle.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] anchorRect : rect
db:section.db:para: The anchor rectangle relative to the parent window geometry that the child surface should be placed relative to.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] configuredGeometry : rect
db:section.db:para: The window geometry the popup received in the configure event. Relative to the upper left corner of the parent surface.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] flipConstraints : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the orientations in which the child should flip to fit within the screen.
Possible values:

db:section.db:title: [read-only] gravityEdges : rect
db:section.db:para: Specifies in what direction the surface should be positioned, relative to the anchor point.
The possible values are:

db:td.db:para: The surface should slide towards the top of the screen.
The surface should slide towards the left of the screen.
The surface should slide towards the right of the screen.
The surface should slide towards the bottom of the screen.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] offset : point
db:section.db:para: The position relative to the position of the anchor on the anchor rectangle and the anchor on the surface.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] parentXdgSurface : XdgSurface
db:section.db:para: This property holds the XdgSurface associated with the parent of this XdgPopup.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] positionerSize : size
db:section.db:para: The size requested for the window geometry by the positioner object.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] resizeConstraints : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the orientations in which the child should resize to fit within the screen.
Possible values:

db:section.db:title: [read-only] slideConstraints : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the orientations in which the child should slide to fit within the screen.
Possible values:

db:section.db:title: [read-only] unconstrainedPosition : point
db:section.db:para: The position of the surface relative to the parent window geometry if the surface is not constrained. I.e. when not moved to fit inside the screen or similar.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] xdgSurface : XdgSurface
db:section.db:para: This property holds the XdgSurface associated with this XdgPopup.

db:section.db:title: int sendConfigure(rect geometry)
db:section.db:para: Sends a configure event to the client. geometry contains the window geometry relative to the upper left corner of the window geometry of the parent surface.
This implicitly sends a configure event to the corresponding XdgSurface as well.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.14] void sendPopupDone()
db:section.db:para: Dismiss the popup. According to the xdg-shell protocol this should make the client destroy the popup.
This method was introduced in Qt 5.14.
